revised_title: The Mechanism and Forces Involved in Bordered Pit Aspiration in Conifer Wood
tldr: This study investigates the forces and mechanisms involved in the aspiration of bordered pits in conifer wood during the drying process. The analysis considers both mechanical forces and surface tension forces in the pit membrane. The results show that earlywood pits are more likely to be aspirated than latewood pits, and that the process involves significant creep in the radial cellulosic strands of the pit membrane.
